Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2008 08:45PM aquariusgi wrote: My mother passed of breast cancer 22 years ago this month. It has haunted me ever since. I've always tried to be pro active about it. SO, going on my former doctor;s advice I knew a mammogram was coming when I turned 33. That made me nervous enough since I turned 30 this year. After describing a thickness in my breast to my current doctor she explained that we should definitely start at 35 since it is rare in younger women. She thought she would humor me and ease my fears by sending me for a mammogram. 5 weeks, later I've had 2 biopsies, diagnosed with LCIS and am waiting for treatment.
Posts.Title: When is a good time daughterofsurvivors aquariusgi

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2009 05:56AM aquariusgi wrote: First off, why did you have a lumpectomy? I had mine after being diagnosed with LCIS (stage 0), this alone puts me at a high risk. Now add in family history (my mother and aunt). I was tryingto put this behind me too. I knew I would freak out just before my 3 month follow-up (physical-today). Now I'm really fraking out because I'm having a mammo and ultrasound tomorrow. I know this will always be a monkey on my back. Do some more research. Stage 0 isn't even considered a cancer....So why am I dealing with this?
Posts.Title: What would you consider high risk? Hindsfeet leaf

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2009 12:21AM aquariusgi wrote: Can anyone tell me if I was suppose to get my test results on paper? As much as I wanted the answer so that I could unfreeze my life...I don't believe the negative results over the phone. Somewhere in the back of my mind I wonder if it really happened.I called my counselor 3 weeks ago just to make double sure (because it seemed like I got the results pretty quick) bu she hasn't gotten back to me. I'm scared to call back...
Posts.Title: BRCA1 & 2 testing shelloz1 gfigman

Posts.Content: Nov 12, 2008 02:45PM aquariusgi wrote: Hi all, I probably haven't logged as much as I should...I say this because I really do feel that the strangers on this site have been more supportive than I had expected. I'm still waiting on a second opinion, MRI and BRAC test even though I've pretty much made up my mind about the Tamoxifen. All of these things are coming up in the next 2 weeks and I am starting to lose it. I'm super stressed about it and everything else in my life. I feel it's starting to take a real toll on my life as much as I try not to have it take over. Does anyone know of any support groups in the Malden, Ma area?
Posts.Title: I'm 29 and I'm really scared!!! jen29 wondering7

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2008 10:59PM aquariusgi wrote: Hello and Welcome! I'm 30 and a single mom of one who was recently diagnosed with LCIS (Sept. 8, 2008). I know what you mean by being on a roller coaster. I went in for a Mammogram and ultrsound one day and before I knew it I was getting ready for a biopsy that same day. The fact that it was even found happened because my doctor thought I was paranoid. The 3 days that followed were the longest. I decided to only read enough to be informed for what the suspisions were. I knew that if I continued to read it would only drive me crazy and I still had to get on with my life and get through the week. My doctor then called and said "everything is fine, no cancer". The next day she called back and said "sorry, there was a mistake. I didn't read the entire report" I have since had the lump taken out and am trying to figure out my treatment options. Since being diagnosed I have decided to educate myself as much as possible on the subject and do what I can to lower my risk.  Being proactive about everything. Setting up my own appointments not waiting for the doctor to do it.
Posts.Title: I'm 29 and I'm really scared!!! jen29 wondering7
